intro: Cathormion leptophyllum var. guineense, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can be somewhat woody. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
